line.text: Lord of my love to whom in vassalage
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Thy merit hath my duty strongly knit
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: To thee I send this written embassage
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: To witness duty not to show my wit
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Duty so great which wit so poor as mine
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: May make seem bare in wanting words to show it
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But that I hope some good conceit of thine
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: In thy soul thought (all naked) will bestow it
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Till whatsoever star that guides my moving
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Points on me graciously with fair aspect
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And puts apparel on my tattered loving
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: To show me worthy of thy sweet respect
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Then may I dare to boast how I do love thee
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Till then not show my head where thou mayst prove me
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
